elements.content: Puckered square grid coordination polymers [M(dps)2]X (M = Cu(I), X = ClO4 (1), PF6 (2); M = Ag(I), X = PF6 (3), CF3SO3 (4); dps = 4,4‘-dipyridylsulfide) have been synthesized and characterized in the solid state by X-ray crystallography. Of these, the cations in 3 and 4 were found to interpenetrate while 1 and 2 were not. However, the anions greatly influence the conformation of the puckered square grids in 1 and 2.
elements.clean_text: Puckered square grid coordination polymers [M(dps)2]X (M = Cu(I), X = ClO4 (1), PF6 (2); M = Ag(I), X = PF6 (3), CF3SO3 (4); dps = 4,4‘-dipyridylsulfide) have been synthesized and characterized in the solid state by X-ray crystallography. Of these, the cations in 3 and 4 were found to interpenetrate while 1 and 2 were not. However, the anions greatly influence the conformation of the puckered square grids in 1 and 2.

elements.content: Subtle changes in the size of the noncoordinating anions and cations lead to the formation three different types of highly wrinkled (4,4) 2D network structures including parallel interpenetrating sheets in [M(dps)2]X (M = Cu(I) and Ag(I); X = ClO4, PF6, and CF3SO3; and dps = 4,4‘-dipyridylsulfide).
elements.clean_text: Subtle changes in the size of the noncoordinating anions and cations lead to the formation three different types of highly wrinkled (4,4) 2D network structures including parallel interpenetrating sheets in [M(dps)2]X (M = Cu(I) and Ag(I); X = ClO4, PF6, and CF3SO3; and dps = 4,4‘-dipyridylsulfide).

elements.content: A major challenge in crystal engineering is the predictability of the polymeric network topology since the topology has been found to depend on several factors such as coordination geometry and oxidation state of the metal, metal-to-ligand ratio, nature of the ligands used, and presence of solvents and counterions. Among various types of networks, the square grid polymers with (4,4) topology are of particular interest due to their predictable pore size and selective inclusion of guest molecules. Interpenetration or self-inclusion of identical networks has been found to be ubiquitous and unpredictable among the 2D network structures. Although open square-grid polymeric structures with high porosity have been reported using judicious choice of guest molecules, large linear spacer ligands, in general, have been found to increase the number of folding to fill the voids within the channels. Intertwining of these 2D motifs with (4,4) topology can occur in parallel and perpendicular or inclined fashion. While rigid rodlike linear spacers favor the formation of inclined interpenetration of 2D sheets, flexible bent ligands usually tend to form parallel intertwining. In this report, a rational synthesis is described for the construction of puckered square grids using 4,4‘-dipyridylsulfide (dps), an angular spacer ligand with nonrigid backbone, and tetrahedral metal ions, Cu(I) and Ag(I). We have shown that these puckered square grids can be fine-tuned to interpenetrate or not to interpenetrate by changing size of the noncoordinating anions and the metal ions.
elements.clean_text: A major challenge in crystal engineering is the predictability of the polymeric network topology since the topology has been found to depend on several factors such as coordination geometry and oxidation state of the metal, metal-to-ligand ratio, nature of the ligands used, and presence of solvents and counterions. Among various types of networks, the square grid polymers with (4,4) topology are of particular interest due to their predictable pore size and selective inclusion of guest molecules. Interpenetration or self-inclusion of identical networks has been found to be ubiquitous and unpredictable among the 2D network structures. Although open square-grid polymeric structures with high porosity have been reported using judicious choice of guest molecules, large linear spacer ligands, in general, have been found to increase the number of folding to fill the voids within the channels. Intertwining of these 2D motifs with (4,4) topology can occur in parallel and perpendicular or inclined fashion. While rigid rodlike linear spacers favor the formation of inclined interpenetration of 2D sheets, flexible bent ligands usually tend to form parallel intertwining. In this report, a rational synthesis is described for the construction of puckered square grids using 4,4‘-dipyridylsulfide (dps), an angular spacer ligand with nonrigid backbone, and tetrahedral metal ions, Cu(I) and Ag(I). We have shown that these puckered square grids can be fine-tuned to interpenetrate or not to interpenetrate by changing size of the noncoordinating anions and the metal ions.

elements.content: Treatment of dps with [Cu(MeCN)4](ClO4) (2:1 ratio) gives creamy hexagonal shaped crystals of [Cu(dps)2](ClO4), 1, by the diffusion method. The crystal structure of this complex revealed the formation of noninterpenetrating puckered square-grid polymers with dimensions 10.66 and 10.70 Å as shown in Figure . These puckered sheets are arranged in the ab plane and stacked along the c-axis with the anions and solvents occupying the gap in the squares. All the Cu atoms in the 2D sheets are in a plane with the dps ligands above the Cu plane when the Cu−dps−Cu connectivity runs in the direction of a-axis and below the Cu plane when the Cu−dps−Cu strands run along b-axis. The C−S−C angles, 103.6(4) and 103.8(4)°, are quite similar.
elements.clean_text: Treatment of dps with [Cu(MeCN)4](ClO4) (2:1 ratio) gives creamy hexagonal shaped crystals of [Cu(dps)2](ClO4), 1, by the diffusion method. The crystal structure of this complex revealed the formation of noninterpenetrating puckered square-grid polymers with dimensions 10.66 and 10.70 Å as shown in Figure . These puckered sheets are arranged in the ab plane and stacked along the c-axis with the anions and solvents occupying the gap in the squares. All the Cu atoms in the 2D sheets are in a plane with the dps ligands above the Cu plane when the Cu-dps-Cu connectivity runs in the direction of a-axis and below the Cu plane when the Cu-dps-Cu strands run along b-axis. The C-S-C angles, 103.6(4) and 103.8(4)°, are quite similar.

elements.content: (a) The [Cu(dps)2]+ puckered sheets in 1. The hydrogen atoms are not shown for clarity. (b) Packing diagram of 1 showing the side view of the puckering.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) The [Cu(dps)2]+ puckered sheets in 1. The hydrogen atoms are not shown for clarity. (b) Packing diagram of 1 showing the side view of the puckering.

elements.content:
<fig id="cg015510zf1" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label></label>
<graphic orientation="portrait" position="float" xlink:href="cg015510zf1.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

A similar but highly distorted noninterpenetrating coordination polymer, [Cu(dps)2](PF6), 2 with (4,4) topology, was obtained when the PF6 - anion is used. Again the packing of the sheets is similar to that of 1. The corrugated (4,4) sheets are packed in the ab planes and stacked along the c direction with the anions and solvents filling the empty space in the lattice. In contrast to 1, not all the copper atoms are coplanar. Half of the copper atoms fall in one plane while the other half fall in a separate parallel plane. Within a single sheet, infinite Cu−dps chains in which the Cu atoms are collinear run in the a direction (Figure ). The corrugated nature of the sheets may be attributed to the flexibility of the backbone of the dps ligand. The interdigitation of the two corrugated 2D sheets (Figure b) indicates that these may be able to interpenetrate in pairs in the parallel mode. However, no such interpenetration has been observed by changing the solvents.
elements.clean_text: A similar but highly distorted noninterpenetrating coordination polymer, [Cu(dps)2](PF6), 2 with (4,4) topology, was obtained when the PF6 - anion is used. Again the packing of the sheets is similar to that of 1. The corrugated (4,4) sheets are packed in the ab planes and stacked along the c direction with the anions and solvents filling the empty space in the lattice. In contrast to 1, not all the copper atoms are coplanar. Half of the copper atoms fall in one plane while the other half fall in a separate parallel plane. Within a single sheet, infinite Cu-dps chains in which the Cu atoms are collinear run in the a direction (Figure ). The corrugated nature of the sheets may be attributed to the flexibility of the backbone of the dps ligand. The interdigitation of the two corrugated 2D sheets (Figure b) indicates that these may be able to interpenetrate in pairs in the parallel mode. However, no such interpenetration has been observed by changing the solvents.

elements.content: (a) Corrugated 2D sheets of [Cu(dps)2]+ in 2. (b) Packing of the wrinkled 2D sheets in the lattice of 2. The hydrogen atoms and the PF6 - anions are not shown.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) Corrugated 2D sheets of [Cu(dps)2]+ in 2. (b) Packing of the wrinkled 2D sheets in the lattice of 2. The hydrogen atoms and the PF6 - anions are not shown.

elements.content: The reaction of AgPF6 or Ag(CF3SO3) with dps in the molar ratio 1:2 affords single crystals of [Ag(dps)2](PF6), 3, or of [Ag(dps)2](CF3SO3), 4, in good yields. Both the compounds crystallized in monoclinic space group C2/c are isotypical. The X-ray crystallography revealed that the cations have highly corrugated 2D sheets with (4,4) topology similar to 2; however, they interpenetrate in pairs in parallel mode (Figure a). A close inspection of the packing along the a-direction (Figure b) indicates the presence of π−π interactions between the pyridyl rings of the interpenetrating corrugate sheets. The pyridyl rings from the two sheets are stacked alternately but are unevenly placed. The closest distance between the pyridyl rings from different sheets are 3.57−3.78 Å in 3 with an interplanar angle of 4.4°, and 3.66−3.74 Å in 4 with an interplanar angle of 1.8°. The separation between the pyridyl rings of the same sheet is 11.09 Å in both 3 and 4. Batten and Robson have discussed the occurrence of various types of parallel and inclined intertwining network structures in their review article. The type of interpenetration observed in 3 and 4 is very similar to that reported for [Cu(tcm)(4,4‘-bpy)]20 (tcm = tricyanomethanide) as depicted in Figure . It may be noted that only noninterpenetrated structures are observed for 1 and 2, although inclined or parallel interpenetration is possible for 1 and 2. The larger size of Ag(I) and the anions, PF6 - and CF3SO3 -, appears to favor the formation of parallel intertwined structures. In contrast, one-dimensional coordination polymers were obtained using AgClO4 under various experimental conditions, and for the ratios of AgClO4/(1−5)dps used. A similar observation was noted before by Moore et al.
elements.clean_text: The reaction of AgPF6 or Ag(CF3SO3) with dps in the molar ratio 1:2 affords single crystals of [Ag(dps)2](PF6), 3, or of [Ag(dps)2](CF3SO3), 4, in good yields. Both the compounds crystallized in monoclinic space group C2/c are isotypical. The X-ray crystallography revealed that the cations have highly corrugated 2D sheets with (4,4) topology similar to 2; however, they interpenetrate in pairs in parallel mode (Figure a). A close inspection of the packing along the a-direction (Figure b) indicates the presence of π-π interactions between the pyridyl rings of the interpenetrating corrugate sheets. The pyridyl rings from the two sheets are stacked alternately but are unevenly placed. The closest distance between the pyridyl rings from different sheets are 3.57-3.78 Å in 3 with an interplanar angle of 4.4°, and 3.66-3.74 Å in 4 with an interplanar angle of 1.8°. The separation between the pyridyl rings of the same sheet is 11.09 Å in both 3 and 4. Batten and Robson have discussed the occurrence of various types of parallel and inclined intertwining network structures in their review article. The type of interpenetration observed in 3 and 4 is very similar to that reported for [Cu(tcm)(4,4‘-bpy)]20 (tcm = tricyanomethanide) as depicted in Figure . It may be noted that only noninterpenetrated structures are observed for 1 and 2, although inclined or parallel interpenetration is possible for 1 and 2. The larger size of Ag(I) and the anions, PF6 - and CF3SO3 -, appears to favor the formation of parallel intertwined structures. In contrast, one-dimensional coordination polymers were obtained using AgClO4 under various experimental conditions, and for the ratios of AgClO4/(1-5)dps used. A similar observation was noted before by Moore et al.

elements.content: (a) The packing of the two highly puckered interpenetrating sheets in3. (b) Side view of the parallel interpenetration in 3 showing the π...π stacking.

elements.content: Compounds 1−4 were crystallized in bulk in several combinations of solvents. However, the X-ray powder diffraction patterns indicated that solvents have little influence on these structures. Hence, the formation of supramolecular isomeric cations appears to be due to the size of the metals ions and the nature of the anions employed. Although no interpenetration occurs in 1 and 2, the influence of the anions on the conformations of the puckered sheets is evident. It is interesting to note that in the presence of noncoordinating anions, interpenetrated adamantanoid structures were obtained for a variety of rigid and flexible bipyridyl derivatives such as 4,4‘-bipyridyl, 3,3‘-bipyridyl, 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoro-1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)benzene, 2,7-diazapyrene, and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethene with tetrahedral metal centers such as Ag(I) and Cu(I) in the ratio 1:2. In contrast, dps, a flexible bipyridine derivative with a bent backbone, has furnished interpenetrating and noninterpenetrating puckered square-grid polymers with Ag(I) and Cu(I), respectively.
elements.clean_text: Compounds 1-4 were crystallized in bulk in several combinations of solvents. However, the X-ray powder diffraction patterns indicated that solvents have little influence on these structures. Hence, the formation of supramolecular isomeric cations appears to be due to the  size of the metals ions and the nature of the anions employed. Although no interpenetration occurs in 1 and 2, the influence of the anions on the conformations of the puckered sheets is evident. It is interesting to note that in the presence of noncoordinating anions, interpenetrated adamantanoid structures were obtained for a variety of rigid and flexible bipyridyl derivatives such as 4,4‘-bipyridyl, 3,3‘-bipyridyl, 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoro-1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)benzene, 2,7-diazapyrene, and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethene with tetrahedral metal centers such as Ag(I) and Cu(I) in the ratio 1:2. In contrast, dps, a flexible bipyridine derivative with a bent backbone, has furnished interpenetrating and noninterpenetrating puckered square-grid polymers with Ag(I) and Cu(I), respectively.

elements.content: In the construction of desired coordination polymeric network structures, in addition to the areas of unpredictability such as subtle balances between the many weak forces of attraction and repulsion, the role played by the nature and size of the metal ions and noncoordinating anions has been exemplified in the present work. Recently, Jung and co-workers have shown similar influence of counteranions on the pitch of helical cations, while Moore and co-workers have developed a constitutive packing model to predict the observed structural deformation induced by counterions of varying size for interpenetrated diamondoid structures. These structurally closely related pseudo supramolecular isomers may serve as theoretical models toward understanding the formation of interpenetration from their individual components and as snapshots of various conformationally related structures in solution.
elements.clean_text: In the construction of desired coordination polymeric network structures, in addition to the areas of unpredictability such as subtle balances between the many weak forces of attraction and repulsion, the role played by the nature and size of the metal ions and noncoordinating anions has been exemplified in the present work. Recently, Jung and co-workers have shown similar influence of counteranions on the pitch of helical cations, while Moore and co-workers have developed a constitutive packing model to predict the observed structural deformation induced by counterions of varying size for interpenetrated diamondoid structures. These structurally closely related pseudo supramolecular isomers may serve as theoretical models toward understanding the formation of interpenetration from their individual components and as snapshots of various conformationally related structures in solution.

metadata.title:
Interpenetrating versus Noninterpenetrating (4,4) Nets:  Influence
of the Size of the Metal and Counter Ions
